content:
SyndicationLink Class

In this Article

Represents a link within a syndication feed or item.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TypeForwardedFrom("System.ServiceModel.Web, Version=3.5.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35")]
public class SyndicationLink

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • SyndicationLink

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

SyndicationLink can be added to a SyndicationFeed or SyndicationItem. When serialized to Atom 1.0 a SyndicationLink is written out as a <link> element, with the SyndicationLink properties written out as attributes of the <link> element. When serialized to RSS 2.0, the first SyndicationLink with a relationship value of â€˜alternateâ€™ is written out as a <link> element. Any additional links are written out as a <a10:link> elements.

Creates a new instance of the SyndicationLink instance.

Constructors

  • SyndicationLink()

    Creates a new instance of the SyndicationLink instance.

    public SyndicationLink ();
  • SyndicationLink(SyndicationLink)

    Initializes a new instance of the SyndicationLink class with the specified instance.

    protected SyndicationLink (System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink source);

    Parameters

    • source
      SyndicationLink

      The SyndicationLink instance used to initialize the new instance.

  • SyndicationLink(Uri)

    Initializes a new instance of the SyndicationLink class with the specified Uri.

    public SyndicationLink (Uri uri);

    Parameters

    • uri
      Uri

      The URI to the linked resource.

    Example

    The following example shows how to call this constructor. 

                SyndicationFeed feed = new SyndicationFeed("Feed Title", "Feed Description", new Uri("http://Feed/Alternate/Link"), "FeedID", DateTime.Now);

            SyndicationLink link = new SyndicationLink(new Uri("http://server/link"));
            feed.Links.Add(link);

            Dim feed As SyndicationFeed = New SyndicationFeed("Feed Title", "Feed Description", New Uri("http://Feed/Alternate/Link"), "FeedID", DateTime.Now)

        Dim link As SyndicationLink = New SyndicationLink(New Uri("http://server/link"))
        feed.Links.Add(link)
  • SyndicationLink(Uri,String,String,String,Int64)

    Initializes a new instance of the SyndicationLink class with the specified Uri, relation type, title, media type, and length.

    public SyndicationLink (Uri uri, string relationshipType, string title, string mediaType, long length);

    Parameters

    • uri
      Uri

      The URI to the linked resource.

    • relationshipType
      String

      The relationship type.

    • title
      String

      The title of the link.

    • mediaType
      String

      The media type of the link.

    • length
      Int64

      The length of the linked content.

    Remarks

    Well-known relationship types include:

    • alternate - The link identifies an alternate version of the resource described by the containing Feed or Item.

    • related - The link identifies a resource related to the containing Feed or Item.

    • self - The link identifies a resource equivalent to the containing Feed or Item.

    • enclosure - The link identifies a related resource that is potentially large in size and might require special handling. This link relation is often used when podcasts or audio files are distributed in a Feed.

    • via - The link identifies a resource that is the source of the information provided in the containing Feed or Item.

    Example

    The following example shows how to call this constructor. 

                SyndicationFeed feed = new SyndicationFeed("Feed Title", "Feed Description", new Uri("http://Feed/Alternate/Link"), "FeedID", DateTime.Now);

            SyndicationLink link = new SyndicationLink(new Uri("http://server/link"), "alternate", "Link Title", "text/html", 1000);
            feed.Links.Add(link);

            Dim feed As SyndicationFeed = New SyndicationFeed("Feed Title", "Feed Description", New Uri("http://Feed/Alternate/Link"), "FeedID", DateTime.Now)

        Dim link As SyndicationLink = New SyndicationLink(New Uri("http://server/link"), "alternate", "Link Title", "text/html", 1000)
        feed.Links.Add(link)

Properties

  • AttributeExtensions

    Gets the attribute extensions of the link.

    public System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary<System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName,string> AttributeExtensions { get; }

    Property Value

    • Dictionary<XmlQualifiedName,String>

      A dictionary that contains a collection of attribute extensions.

    Remarks

    AttributeExtensions allows you to add custom attributes to the SyndicationLink. When serialized to Atom 1.0, the custom attributes appear within the <link> element. When serialized to RSS 2.0, the custom attributes appear in the <a10:link> element. Any valid XML attribute can be added.

    Example

    The following code shows how to add an attribute extension to a syndication link. 

                SyndicationLink link = new SyndicationLink(new Uri("http://server/link"));
            link.AttributeExtensions.Add(new XmlQualifiedName("myAttribute", ""), "someValue");

            Dim link As New SyndicationLink(New Uri("http://server/link"))
        link.AttributeExtensions.Add(New XmlQualifiedName("myAttribute", ""), "someValue")
  • BaseUri

    Gets and sets the base URI of the syndication link.

    public Uri BaseUri { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Uri

      A Uri instance that contains the base URI of the syndication link.

    Example

    The following code shows how to set the base URI of a syndication link.

  • ElementExtensions

    Gets the element extensions for the SyndicationLink.

    public System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationElementExtensionCollection ElementExtensions { get; }

    Property Value

    • SyndicationElementExtensionCollection

      A SyndicationElementExtensionCollection that contains the element extensions for the SyndicationLink.

    Remarks

    Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace.

    Example

    The following code shows how to add an element extension to a syndication link. 

                SyndicationLink link = new SyndicationLink();
            link.ElementExtensions.Add("simpleString", "", "hello, world!");

            Dim link As New SyndicationLink()
        link.ElementExtensions.Add("simpleString", "", "hello, world!")
  • Length

    Gets and sets the length of the linked resource in bytes.

    public long Length { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int64

      The length of the linked resource.

    Remarks

    When serialized to Atom 1.0 the Length property is written as a length attribute in the <link> element.

    When serialized to RSS 2.0 this value is written as the length attribute of the <a10:link> element.

    Example

    The following code shows how to set the length of a syndication link.

    The following XML shows how the Length property is serialized to Atom 1.0. 

      <link customAttribute="value" rel="alternate" type="text/html" title="Link Title" length="1000" href="http://server/link" />

    The following XML shows how the Length property is serialized to RSS 2.0. 

        <a10:link customAttribute="value" rel="alternate" type="text/html" title="Link Title" length="1000" href="http://server/link" />
  • MediaType

    Gets and sets the media type of the linked resource.

    public string MediaType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The media type of the linked resource.

    Remarks

    When serialized to Atom 1.0 this value is written as a type attribute in the <link> element. When serialized to RSS 2.0 this value is written as the type attribute in the <a10:link> element.

    Example

    The following code shows how to set the media type on a syndication link.

    The following XML shows how the MediaType property is serialized to Atom 1.0. 

      <link customAttribute="value" rel="alternate" type="text/html" title="Link Title" length="1000" href="http://server/link" />

    The following XML shows how the MediaType property is serialized to RSS 2.0. 

        <a10:link customAttribute="value" rel="alternate" type="text/html" title="Link Title" length="1000" href="http://server/link" />
  • RelationshipType

    Gets and sets the relationship type of the linked resource.

    public string RelationshipType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The relationship type of the linked resource.

    Remarks

    Well-known relationship types include:

    • alternate - The link identifies an alternate version of the resource described by the containing Feed or Item.

    • related - The link identifies a resource related to the containing Feed or Item.

    • self - The link identifies a resource equivalent to the containing Feed or Item.

    • enclosure - The link identifies a related resource that is potentially large in size and might require special handling. This link relation is often used when podcasts or audio files are distributed in a Feed.

    • via - The link identifies a resource that is the source of the information provided in the containing Feed or Item.

      When serialized to Atom 1.0 this value is written out as the rel attribute of the <link> element. When serialized to RSS 2.0, this value is written out as the rel attribute in the <a10:link> element.

    Example

    The following code shows how to set the relationship type of a syndication link.

    The following XML shows how the RelationshipType property is serialized to Atom 1.0. 

      <link customAttribute="value" rel="alternate" type="text/html" title="Link Title" length="1000" href="http://server/link" />

    The following XML shows how the RelationshipType property is serialized to RSS 2.0. 

        <a10:link customAttribute="value" rel="alternate" type="text/html" title="Link Title" length="1000" href="http://server/link" />
  • Title

    Gets and sets the title of the linked resource.

    public string Title { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The title of the linked resource.

    Remarks

    When serialized to Atom 1.0 this value is written out as the title attribute in the <link> element.

    When serialized to RSS 2.0 the title is written out as the title attribute in the <a10:link> element.

    Example

    The following code shows how to set the title of a syndication link. 

                SyndicationFeed feed = new SyndicationFeed("Feed Title", "Feed Description", new Uri("http://Feed/Alternate/Link"), "FeedID", DateTime.Now);

            SyndicationLink link = new SyndicationLink(new Uri("http://server/link"), "alternate", "Link Title", "text/html", 1000);
            feed.Links.Add(link);

            Dim feed As SyndicationFeed = New SyndicationFeed("Feed Title", "Feed Description", New Uri("http://Feed/Alternate/Link"), "FeedID", DateTime.Now)

        Dim link As SyndicationLink = New SyndicationLink(New Uri("http://server/link"), "alternate", "Link Title", "text/html", 1000)
        feed.Links.Add(link)

    The following XML shows how the Title property is serialized to Atom 1.0. 

      <link customAttribute="value" rel="alternate" type="text/html" title="Link Title" length="1000" href="http://server/link" />

    The following XML shows how the Title property is serialized to RSS 2.0. 

        <a10:link customAttribute="value" rel="alternate" type="text/html" title="Link Title" length="1000" href="http://server/link" />
  • Uri

    Gets and sets the URI for the linked resource.

    public Uri Uri { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Uri

      A Uri instance that contains the URI for the linked resource.

    Remarks

    When serialized to Atom 1.0 this value is written out as the href attribute in the <link> element.

    When serialized to RSS 2.0, this value is written out as the href attribute in the <a10:link> element.

    Example

    The following code shows how to set the URI of a syndication link.

    The following XML shows how the Uri property is serialized to Atom 1.0. 

      <link customAttribute="value" rel="alternate" type="text/html" title="Link Title" length="1000" href="http://server/link" />

    The following XML shows how the Uri property is serialized to RSS 2.0. 

        <a10:link customAttribute="value" rel="alternate" type="text/html" title="Link Title" length="1000" href="http://server/link" />

            Dim link As SyndicationLink = SyndicationLink.CreateAlternateLink(New Uri("http://server/link"))
  • CreateAlternateLink(Uri,String)

    Creates a new SyndicationLink object with the specified Uri and media type.

    public static System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink CreateAlternateLink (Uri uri, string mediaType);

    Parameters

    • uri
      Uri

      The URI of the linked resource.

    • mediaType
      String

      The media type of the link.

    Returns

    • SyndicationLink

      A new SyndicationLink instance.

    Example

    The following example shows how to create an alternate link. 

                SyndicationLink link = SyndicationLink.CreateAlternateLink(new Uri("http://server/link"), "text/html");

            Dim link As SyndicationLink = SyndicationLink.CreateAlternateLink(New Uri("http://server/link"), "text/html")
  • CreateMediaEnclosureLink(Uri,String,Int64)

    Creates a media enclosure link with the specified URI, media type, and length.

    public static System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink CreateMediaEnclosureLink (Uri uri, string mediaType, long length);

    Parameters

    • uri
      Uri

      The URI of the linked resource.

    • mediaType
      String

      The media type of the link.

    • length
      Int64

      The length of the linked content.

    Returns

    • SyndicationLink

      A new SyndicationLink instance.

    Remarks

    This method creates a new SyndicationLink object and sets RelationshipType to enclosure.

    Example

    The following example shows how to create a media enclosure link. 

                SyndicationLink link = SyndicationLink.CreateMediaEnclosureLink(new Uri("http://server/link"), "audio/mpeg", 100000);

            Dim link As SyndicationLink = SyndicationLink.CreateMediaEnclosureLink(New Uri("http://server/link"), "audio/mpeg", 100000)
  • CreateSelfLink(Uri)

    Creates a new SyndicationLink with the specified URI and relationship type set to self.

    public static System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink CreateSelfLink (Uri uri);

    Parameters

    Returns

      A SyndicationLink instance.

    Example

    The following example shows how to create a self link. 

                SyndicationLink link = SyndicationLink.CreateSelfLink(new Uri("http://server/link"));

            Dim link As SyndicationLink = SyndicationLink.CreateSelfLink(New Uri("http://server/link"))
  • CreateSelfLink(Uri,String)

    Creates a new SyndicationLink with the specified URI, media type, and relationship type set to self.

    public static System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink CreateSelfLink (Uri uri, string mediaType);

      A SyndicationLink instance.

    Example

    The following example shows how to create a self link.

            Dim link As SyndicationLink = SyndicationLink.CreateSelfLink(New Uri("http://server/link"), "text/html")
  • GetAbsoluteUri()

    Gets the absolute URI for the SyndicationLink.

    public Uri GetAbsoluteUri ();

    Returns

    • Uri

      A Uri instance that contains the absolute URI of the SyndicationLink.

    Example

    The following code shows how to get the absolute URI of a syndication link.

  • TryParseAttribute(String,String,String,String)

    Attempts to parse an attribute extension.

    protected virtual bool TryParseAttribute (string name, string ns, string value, string version);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the element.

    • ns
      String

      The namespace of the element.

    • value
      String

      The attribute to parse.

    • version
      String

      The syndication version to use when parsing.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      A value that specifies whether the attribute extension was parsed successfully.

    Exceptions

    • XmlException

      Invalid XML encountered during read.

    Remarks

    Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. They are serialized as an attribute of the <link> element. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom attribute extension. To do this, you must derive a class from SyndicationLink and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.

  • TryParseElement(XmlReader,String)

    Attempts to parse an element extension.

    protected virtual bool TryParseElement (System.Xml.XmlReader reader, string version);

    Parameters

    • reader
      XmlReader

      The XmlReader to read from.

    • version
      String

      The syndication version to use while parsing.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      A value that specifies whether the element extension was parsed successfully.

    Exceptions

    • XmlException

      Invalid XML encountered during read.

    Remarks

    Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom element extension. To do this, you must derive a class from SyndicationLink and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized element extensions.

    Writes the attribute extensions to the specified XmlWriter using the specified syndication version.

    Remarks

    Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. They are serialized as an attribute of the <link> element. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the serialization of custom attribute extensions. To do this, you must derive a class from SyndicationLink and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.

  • WriteElementExtensions(XmlWriter,String)

    Writes the element extensions to the specified XmlWriter using the specified syndication version.

    protected virtual void WriteElementExtensions (System.Xml.XmlWriter writer, string version);

    Parameters

    • writer
      XmlWriter

      The XmlReader to write to.

    • version
      String

      The syndication version to use while writing.

    Remarks

    Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the serialization of custom element extensions. To do this, you must derive a class from SyndicationLink and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized element extensions.
